entry.title: OSU Extension offers forestry program in Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Oregon State University Extension Office in Roseburg will offer a five-part series on small woodland management beginning on Jan. 24, 2024. The office is located at 1134 SE Douglas Ave. in Roseburg.

entry.title: Fish and Wildlife to host hunting class in Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife will host a hunting education field day Jan. 20 at the Roseburg Rod and Gun Club, 875 Old Del Rio Road, Roseburg. The class will run 8 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and…

entry.title: Everyone deserves a warm Christmas meal, woman hands out cookies and burritos
entry.summary: Dee Jay spent her weekend rolling bean, cheese and rice burritos, and baking sheets of sugar and oatmeal chocolate chip cookies for her holiday tradition: handing them out to the homeless community.

entry.title: Dealing with grief, gifted a holiday meal and toys
entry.summary: Anna Tavitas lost her spouse to a three-year battle with liver cancer just one month before Christmas.

entry.title: Lawmakers call for expanded funding for community health centers
entry.summary: Oregon U.S. Senators Ron Wyden and Jeff Merkley, along with Representatives Suzanne Bonamici and Andrea Salinas, joined bipartisan colleagues this week to urge the Health Resources and Services Administration to provide more access to federal resources for community healthcare centers.

entry.title: Library grateful for Douglas ESD partnership
entry.summary: One of the biggest wins in Roseburg Public Library’s first five years is our partnership with the Douglas Education Service District (ESD).

entry.title: Roseburg Elks Lodge hands out gratitude grants
entry.summary: The Roseburg Elks Lodge presented five $700 grants to local nonprofit organizations on Dec. 8. The money was given to the lodge from the Elks National Foundation’s Community Investment Program. The lodge received the money by reaching various benchmarks determined…

entry.title: Douglas Timber Operators award community members
entry.summary: Douglas Timber Operators awarded Pat Skrip, Paul Beck and Tim Freeman with the organization's Tough Tree Award, for going above and beyond for the forest industry, timber workers and natural resource dependent communities.

entry.title: Fish derby hosts events Jan. 31-Feb. 3
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — The 32nd Annual Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby events are set for Jan. 31-Feb. 3, 2024. These events benefit fish restoration, enhancement and education projects in the Umpqua Basin.

entry.title: Tyrone Powell back in court after a year on the lam
entry.summary: A man who had been on the lam for more than a year after he reportedly conned an Elkton woman out of her land was back in court Thursday, apparently unable to speak or move much on his own.

entry.title: State police investigates commercial vehicle crash
entry.summary: SCOTTS VALLEY — Troopers with the Oregon State Police investigated a two-commercial vehicle accident early Wednesday, which halted northbound freeway traffic for a time.

entry.title: Operation Joy supplies 'sparkling gifts' to those in need
entry.summary: It was difficult to find a parking spot Thursday at The Salvation Army in Roseburg as Operation Joy commenced.

entry.title: Wild spring Chinook harvest prohibited on North/Mainstem Umpqua
entry.summary: Keeping adult and jack wild spring Chinook salmon on the north and mainstem Umpqua rivers will be prohibited from Feb. 1 through June 30, 2024.

entry.title: DENSE FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 7:00 A.M. FRIDAY
entry.summary: December 22, 2023 3:50 a.m. A Dense Fog Advisory is in effect through 7:00 a.m. Friday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said visibility of less than a quarter of a mile in dense fog is expected. The Advisory area includes the Umpqua, Illinois, Applegate and Rogue valleys and applies...

entry.title: OREGON REGISTERED DOMESTIC PARTNERSHIPS EXPAND TO ALL COUPLES

entry.title: Douglas County Cancer Services to deliver holiday meals
entry.summary: Douglas County Cancer Services is home-delivering meals to patients Saturday to relieve some of their stress.

entry.title: Local teachers invited to apply for teachers grant
entry.summary: Douglas County teachers are invited to apply for a Fund for Teachers Grant from The Ford Family Foundation.
